DOC.brief_summary: This study is assessing the effects of a pre-workout dietary supplement.
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to examine the acute effects of a pre-workout dietary supplement at a standard dose and one that is delivered at 150% of the standard dose on energy metabolism, cardiovascular hemodynamics, blood metabolites and mental focus.
DOC.criteria: Participants must be apparently healthy males and/or females between the ages of 18 and 40 Participants must have at least 6 months immediate prior history of resistance training including the bench press and leg press/squat Participants who have a history of treatment for metabolic disease (i.e., diabetes), hypertension, hypotension, thyroid disease, arrhythmias and/or cardiovascular disease Participants who currently use any prescription medication Participants who are intolerant to caffeine and/or other natural stimulants Participants who are pregnant or lactating women Participants who have a history of smoking Participants who drink excessively (12 drinks per week)
